title: ICE: librustc/ty/adjustment.rs:236: the 1th autoderef for 24315 failed: _

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
ICE that happens (in my case) when borrowing a value from a slice obtained with get().unwrap()

**I tried this code:**

Not sure how wide I should be when posting the faulty code, let's go with this:

``` rust
// you might need to known the following:
// param_id is of type usize and comes from an enumerate which does not involve any variable below
// args is of type &[Box<Expression>], Expression being a simple struct
// param.default_value is of type Option<Expression>
// I want expression to be of type &Expression
let expression = {
    if param_id < args.len() {
        &args.get(param_id).unwrap()
//      ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ICE happens here
    } else if let Some(ref e) = param.default_value {
        e
    } else {
        return Err(Error { kind: ErrorKind::ExpectedArgument(param.name.clone()), span: span})
    }
};
```

**I expected to see this happen:** I expected everything to compile properly, and to optain my variable expression of type &Expression

**Instead, this happened:** I got an ICE. Here is the full error log:

```
src\interpreter/mod.rs:602:21: 602:49 error: internal compiler error: ../src/librustc\ty\adjustment.rs:236: the 1th autoderef for 24315 failed: _
src\interpreter/mod.rs:602                     &args.get(param_id).unwrap()
                                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', ../src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:580
```
## Meta

```
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.11.0-nightly
```
